frameDefinitions: A Recipient (who may or may not be agentive) ends up in possession of a Mass_theme (which may be conceptualized as a single mass entity, or may be a group of individual entities).
A Creator  produces a physical object which is to serve as a Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event, the Represented.
A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event.
An Agent schedules an Event to take place at a specified Scheduled_time and Place.
An Agent produces a Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of)  a Standard.

These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
frameExamples: Bogs <t>accumulate</t> carbon for thousands of years.
Epstein saw the machine-man and <t>carved</t> him in shiny metal.
Diagrams must be clearly <t>drawn</t> on construction paper. CNI
Gina <t>scheduled</t> a dentist appointment for Monday in Berkeley.
So who was it that <t>faked</t> the photo 'showing' Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Recipient</fen> indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen>.
The collection of objects that ends up in the <fen>Recipient</fen>'s possession.
When the event occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> denotes where the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> is acquired.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity--which may be a thing, an action or a state--that is represented by the <fen>Representation</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the artist produces the representation.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Representation</fen>.
The sentient being who schedules an <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident that the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Event</fen> is scheduled to take place.
This role describes the time at which the scheduling occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Forgery</fen> is the product that the <fen>Agent</fen> creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to pass the <fen>Forgery</fen> off as.
The time at which the forgery takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a <fen>Forgery</fen>.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
listRoleExamples: Since <fex>Frans</fex> photographed them ten years ago the population has increased.
When Nadar photographed <fex>her</fex>, Desbordes-Valmore was sixty-eight.
I drew him <fex>at work</fex> a bunch of times, mainly for the amusement of the staff.
Supposedly, <fex>the artist</fex> drew the picture from memory.

Most of us know where we took <fex>a photo</fex> but have a harder time remembering the time
we took it.
My brother took this picture in France <fex>almost 10 years ago</fex>, and has recently scanned it in.
I took this picture <fex>in Italy</fex> a couple of weeks ago.
<fex>I</fex> set up a meeting with Carlos on Monday.
I'd like to set up <fex>a meeting with Mr. Hofmann</fex>.
Gina scheduled a dentist appointment for Monday <fex>in Berkeley</fex>.
